subject: Rectification of Pavement Distresses Observed during NSV Testing and Submission of Action Taken Report through Priority Maintenance Module of Datalake Portal; NHAl -reg.
text: HRdy 7754 rTHrfqfeaprot (73q5 4Rdav &r rArf 4AT4, 4Ra TTR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Hry44 7ua #-5 & 6, 87z7-10, ERV, # fovlf 110 075 0 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 3H4/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAII Policy Guidelines/ Miscellaneous/ 2025 Policy Circular No.18.101/2025 dated 11th March, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/NSV / NewRFP2O2Z-Part(8) (Comp. No. 270261)} Sub: Rectification of Pavement Distresses Observed during NSV Testing and Submission of Action Taken Report through Priority Maintenance Module of Datalake Portal, NHAI -reg: Ingorder to effectively monitor the rectification of the pavement distresses identified through Network Survey Vehicle (NSV) , Priority Maintenance Module (PMM) was developed in NHAI Datalake System_ The detailed Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for Priority Maintenance Module (PMM), developed in NHAI Datalake Portal was issued vide Circular No. NHAI/HO/ Priority Maintenance/47892/2021/E-334783 dated 13.12.2021 (URL of PMM) 2 With the recent technological advances, experience gained and revamping of NSV Testing Method at NHAI, requirement for major Up gradation in the above-mentioned Module was observed and accordingly the same has been carried out. Accordingly, the aforesaid earlier Circular stands amended and replaced by the instant Guidelines. 3. This upgraded Module shall be accessible to all the Stakeholders which includes NHAI HQ, Regional Offices   (ROs) , Project Implementation Units   (PIUs) ,  Authority Engineer / Independent Engineer (AE/ IE), Contractor/ Concessionaire and the NSV Agency. The current Module (PMM) broadly covers Five Pavement Distress i.e Roughness, Rutting, Cracking, Ravelling and Potholes  The PMM Captures the Comparison of the acceptable limits of above-mentioned pavement distresses as per the Contract/ Concession Agreement W.r.t the values observed during the NSV Survey: 4 The flow of Activities in the PMM are mentioned as under: 1. Uploading NSV Report in PMM by the NSV Agency Flow under Priority 2. Acceptance/ Review by NSV Cell, NHAI HQ Maintenance Module 3. Submission of Action Taken Report (ATR) by the concerned NHAI PIU Local Mechanism at PIU Level Input from Authority Input from Contractor/ Engineer/ Independent Concessionaire Authority Contd_2I - In a 74 NHAL
